data.description: About Anthropic Anthropic’s mission is to create reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our users and for society as a whole. Our team is a quickly growing group of committed researchers, engineers, policy experts, and business leaders working together to build beneficial AI systems.About Anthropic Anthropic’s mission is to create reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our users and for society as a whole. Our team is a quickly growing group of committed researchers, engineers, policy experts, and business leaders working together to build beneficial AI systems. About the role Anthropic is seeking a strategic Segment Marketing Lead to support the startup marketing strategy at Anthropic, partnering directly with leading VCs (Y Combinator, Lightspeed Ventures, Accel) to help AI-native startups and developers build with Claude. This is a 0-to-1 opportunity—you'll be our first dedicated startup segment marketer, building the strategy and program infrastructure from the ground up. You'll define how Anthropic engages with the fastest-growing segment in technology and become our face to the VC ecosystem, directly influencing how thousands of developers and founders approach AI development. Responsibilities: Enable strategic VC partnerships that drive portfolio engagement—design and launch co-marketing programs with tier-1 VCs (YC, Lightspeed, Bessemer, and more) Stand up scaled ABM programs for high-value startup accounts—build tiered programs balancing personalization with scale, own full lifecycle from selection through conversion Create developer and founder engagement strategies that resonate with technical audiences—build content, community, and campaigns that earn respect (technical documentation, developer events, founder-to-founder programs, authentic community engagement) Design and execute targeted events and programs for VC portfolios - help create Demo Days, office hours, workshops, and facilitate founder dinners that provide genuine value Extend and adapt foundational product marketing messages into fully-developed, startup-specific campaign materials—including creating slides, email copy, technical content, and sales enablement materials with minimal guidance Define success metrics and drive continuous optimization—establish KPIs, build dashboards, conduct A/B testing, own pipeline contribution and conversion rates Partner closely with Venture Partnerships, Sales, Solutions, Product and manage both Field Marketing and Growth Marketing to drive integrated strategies Align with startup sales teams on account prioritization, goals, and engagement strategies Key objectives: Build tight alignment with VC ecosystem and startup sales teams Scale pipeline generation within AI-native startup segment Establish Anthropic as the AI partner of choice for high-growth startups Drive developer and founder adoption through authentic technical engagement You may be a good fit if you: Have 7+ years in B2B marketing roles focused on startups, developers, or technical founders (product marketing, developer relations, growth marketing, or segment marketing) Have built relationships with VCs, worked at a VC firm, or successfully partnered with accelerators/VCs to drive portfolio engagement Can speak credibly about technical products to technical audiences—understand AI concepts, developer workflows, and technical use cases well enough to review content and guide messaging Excel at 0-to-1 program building—comfortable building from scratch, wearing multiple hats, and scaling based on data Are data-driven with strong analytical skills—experienced with Salesforce, marketing analytics, A/B testing, and measuring program ROI Possess exceptional communication skills and can create compelling content—outstanding writer who crafts narratives for founders, developers, and VCs Have strong stakeholder management skills and work seamlessly across sales, product, and marketing teams Thrive in fast-paced environments with bias to action and comfort with ambiguity Ideal candidates may also have: Direct experience working for or with venture capital firms like Y Combinator, Lightspeed Ventures, Accel, a16z, Sequoia Capital Developer advocate or developer relations background with active presence in technical communities (GitHub, Stack Overflow, X, technical forums) Technical background (former developer role, or equivalent hands-on experience with code and AI) Role-specific policy: For this role, we expect all staff to be able to work from our San Francisco office at least 2 days a week, though we encourage you to apply even if you might need some flexibility for an interim period of time for relocation. Deadline to apply: None. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until December 19th, then will continue review after January 5th. The annual compensation range for this role is below. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. Our total compensation package for full-time employees includes equity and benefits.Annual Salary:$255,000 - $320,000 USDLogistics Education requirements: We require at least a Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.Location-based hybrid policy: Currently, we expect all staff to be in one of our offices at least 25% of the time. However, some roles may require more time in our offices. Visa sponsorship: We do sponsor visas! However, we aren't able to successfully sponsor visas for every role and every candidate. But if we make you an offer, we will make every reasonable effort to get you a visa, and we retain an immigration lawyer to help with this. We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.Your safety matters to us. To protect yourself from potential scams, remember that Anthropic recruiters only contact you from @anthropic.com email addresses. Be cautious of emails from other domains. Legitimate Anthropic recruiters will never ask for money, fees, or banking information before your first day. If you're ever unsure about a communication, don't click any links—visit anthropic.com/careers directly for confirmed position openings. How we're different We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact — advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI — rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills. The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research. This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3, Circuit-Based Interpretability, Multimodal Neurons, Scaling Laws, AI & Compute, Concrete Problems in AI Safety, and Learning from Human Preferences. Come work with us! Anthropic is a public benefit corporation headquartered in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues. Guidance on Candidates' AI Usage: Learn about our policy for using AI in our application process
